meanings.definition: To inhabit or live in (a place)
meanings.sent1: The ants were populating the anthill with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent2: The city started populating rapidly after the new job opportunities arose.
meanings.sent3: The idea of squirrels populating a treehouse sounds like a fun children's story.
meanings.sent4: The garden was populating with colorful flowers, creating a vibrant scene.
meanings.sent5: The forest was populating with various animal species, creating a harmonious ecosystem.

meanings.definition: To fill with inhabitants; to settle in (a place)
meanings.sent1: The pioneers were populating the new land with their families and livestock.
meanings.sent2: The small town started populating as more people moved in for the new factory jobs.
meanings.sent3: The idea of penguins populating a tropical island would make for an interesting cartoon.
meanings.sent4: The library was populating with eager readers, each lost in their own world of books.
meanings.sent5: The aquarium was populating with colorful fish, delighting visitors of all ages.
